Being poor is not a crime. Let’s end cash bail in Nevada.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

The Nevada Legislature is taking up a bill that could fix our broken cash bail systems. This has been one of our top priorities going into the 2019 session, and we need your help to see it through!

The Assembly Judiciary Committee heard AB325 on Thursday, and we can’t move it forward without you. There are a couple ways you can make your voice heard: You can leave a comment on the bill online or contact your legislators directly.

What we can’t do is sit this fight out.

The cash bail system only works for the wealthy and the bail industry. In Nevada, people who are economically disadvantaged find themselves stuck behind bars — losing their jobs and even their homes — even before they are convicted.

Cash bail affects people unequally based on wealth and race. People of color are already over-policed and arrested more than their white counterparts. This system of wealth-based incarceration intensifies this discrimination in the criminal justice system.

We have a chance now to end cash bail. Join us.

ACLU of Nevada
